thread.title: Matthew Perry reveals Jimmy Kimmel that he once 'beat up' Justin Trudeau - Times of India
thread.title_full: Matthew Perry reveals Jimmy Kimmel that he once 'beat up' Justin Trudeau - Times of India

title: Matthew Perry reveals Jimmy Kimmel that he once 'beat up' Justin Trudeau - Times of India
text: Koffee With Karan: Kapil Sharma's episode not dropped Matthew Perry reveals Jimmy Kimmel that he once 'beat up' Justin Trudeau Former 'FRIENDS' star Matthew Perry appeared on Jimmy Kimmel's show on Wednesday (March 16) and the actor made a lot of revelations. TNN | Updated: Mar 17, 2017, 03.50 PM IST Former 'FRIENDS' star Matthew Perry appeared on Jimmy Kimmel 's show on Wednesday (March 16) and the actor made a lot of revelations. While most people eagerly share their stories about encountering Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau , Matthew told a story which he was not very proud of. "We actually beat up Trudeau", Perry recounted on Jimmy Kimmel Live. "I think he was excelling at a sport that we weren't, so it was pure jealousy. And, you know, we beat him up," the Friends actor recalled. READ ALSO: Matt LeBlanc is 'Friends' forever with Matthew Perry "His dad was prime minister, but I don't think that's the reason we beat him up. I think he was the only kid in school we could beat up ... I'm not bragging about this. This is terrible. I was a stupid kid." Born in the U.S., Perry moved to Ottawa with his Canadian mother after his parents split during his infancy. She found a job working for the Liberal Party and eventually became a press aide to then-prime minister Pierre Trudeau. Perry, who recalled being a few years older than Justin Trudeau, attended Rockcliffe Park Public School with him. The Ottawa primary school is where many politicians and ambassadors send their children. "I think I was rather instrumental in him going to such heights, becoming prime minister," Perry quipped about the younger Trudeau to Kimmel. "No, no. I feel shame. I don't want to think about it."
